Name: Disapproval of a determination by the HPD to approve the transfer of the property located at 500 West 174 Street, Manhattan.
Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 500 West 174 Street, also known as Block 213, Lot 44, in the borough of Manhattan
Summary: This bill would disprove the transfer of the property located at 500 West 174 Street, also known as Block 213, Lot 44, in the borough of Manhattan to a third party through the Department of Housing Preservation and Development’s Third Party Transfer program.
Text:
Preconsidered Int. No.1206

By Council Member Rodriguez

..Title
A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 500 West 174 Street, also known as Block 213, Lot 44, in the borough of Manhattan
..Body

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      Section 1. In accordance with the provisions of section 11-412.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, the determination by the department of housing preservation and development to authorize the transfer by the department of finance of the property located at 500 West 174 Street, also known as Block 213, Lot 44, in the borough of Manhattan, to transferees selected by the department of housing preservation and development, is hereby disapproved.
      � 2. In the event that the mayor disapproves this local law, the determination of the department of housing preservation and development to authorize the transfer of the property as set forth in section one of this local law shall not be deemed approved until the council shall have failed to repass such local law in accordance with section thirty-seven of the of the charter or the period within which such repassing may occur has elapsed.  In the event that such local law is repassed in accordance with section thirty-seven of the charter, such determination of the department of housing preservation and development shall be deemed to be disapproved.
      � 3.  This local law takes effect immediately and shall be deemed to have been in full force and effect on the date it was first passed by the council.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. In accordance with the provisions of section 11-412.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, the determination by the department of housing preservation and development to authorize the transfer by the department of finance of the property located at \lang1024 500 West 174 Street\lang1033 , also known as Block \lang1024 213\lang1033 , Lot \lang1024 44\lang1033 , in the borough of \lang1024 Manhattan\lang1033 , to transferees selected by the department of housing preservation and development, is hereby disapproved.\par
\'a7 2. In the event that the mayor disapproves this local law, the determination of the department of housing preservation and development to authorize the transfer of the property as set forth in section one of this local law shall not be deemed approved until the council shall have failed to repass such local law in accordance with section thirty-seven of the of the charter or the period within which such repassing may occur has elapsed.  In the event that such local law is repassed in accordance with section thirty-seven of the charter, such determination of the department of housing preservation and development shall be deemed to be disapproved.\par
\cf1\'a7 3.  This local law takes effect immediately and shall be deemed to have been in full force and effect on the date it was first passed by the council.\cf0\par
